page.title: 01Brightwalton & Chaddleworth
page.content: Brightwalton area is mainly{farmland with{pasture}and some{arable.Livestock includes{sheep,pigs,cows,horses.Crops consist of{wheat,barley,rape and grass for{silage.}The countryside is open with fields,hedges,trees and woods. {Wildlife}includes{pheasants,rabbits, {hares,deer,foxes,and badgers.}The village is very small having some{220 {inhabitants.}It is situated about{190m above sea level. The{buildings}are mainly old{cottages,}some{thatched};at very high prices,some{council housing. {The school}is small and quite old. There are{28 pupils}from the area and 2 full time teachers.}Opposite the school is the{village hall, recreation {ground}where cricket is played in the summer, and a small{playground for {children.}The{church}which is not very old is to the east of the school, adjoining it.
